text.base: The bathroom light hums, a dying insect trapped in amber. You grip the porcelain sink. It's cracked. You look up. The face in the mirror is familiar, but the eyes are strangers.

lens.believer: The reflection lags. Just for a microsecond. The thing in the glass moves *after* you do. It's watching you from the other side.
lens.skeptic: Dilated pupils. Capillaries burst in the left sclera. Impact trauma vs. chemical agent. You look like a man who just walked away from a car crash.
lens.haunted: You expect to see the Detective. The Hero. But you see Him. The man who froze in the Boathouse. The coward.

board_updates.label: The Mirror Lag
board_updates.description: My reflection didn't move in sync with me. Suggests dissociation or... something worse.

choices.label: I see a Detective. Cold, rational, seeking facts. [Set REASON: High]
I see a Conduit. Sensitive, open to the unseen. [Set INTUITION: High]
I see a Survivor. Haunted by the past, but still standing. [Set PRESENCE: High]
